locutie.beschrijving: The sermon explores the metaphor of life as an 'uneven journey' and the human necessity for divine guidance based on Psalm 25 and the Shepherd imagery of Psalm 23.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Moderate. The sermon uses the text as a springboard for a thematic exploration of human limitation vs. divine omniscience rather than a verse-by-verse exposition.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher primarily asserts the reality of human helplessness and then shifts to promising Christ's guidance as the 'Waymaker'.
voorbeelden: I lay strong claim to being educated as a Christian.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To induce humility (breaking of pride) and a sense of relief/trust in the hearer.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit. The Spirit is not explicitly named as the agent of the 'event', though the 'peace of God' is mentioned as a result.

voorbeelden: The writer of the twenty-fifth psalm saw it so.
Do not dismiss out of hand the findings of those in evening years.
Give them the benefit of the doubt.
Thank God, I do know One who knows the answers.
He does promise to answer if we will call upon him.
Surely goodness and mercy shall follow me.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strong toward the end, but often framed as 'He does promise' (asserting a promise) rather than 'I promise you in His name'.

voorbeelden: You can walk out of here this morning a saved soul.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher uses the authority of the 'Way' to declare a change in the hearer's status, though it is often conditional ('if you can truly repeat').

indicatoren: Extended anecdotes about Uncle Mannie and student days.
Long descriptions of the stages of life (sunrise/sunset).
Talking about the psalmist's prayer rather than praying it over the congregation.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes an observer of a 'journey' rather than a participant in a current encounter.

performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is told that grace is available, but must 'repeat words' to activate it.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: High theological quality but often third-person ('He shall restore').
voorbeelden: He does promise to answer if we will call upon him.
Christ Jesus is our shepherd and he is with us.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Personal anecdotes and pastoral identification ('I for one lay bold claim').

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address to 'young people' and 'you Christian people'.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used to set conditions for salvation/peace.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing 'the pilgrim', 'the writer', 'Uncle Mannie', and 'the student'.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a narrative distance where the hearer watches others learn the lesson.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General truths about life and human nature.

actueel_present.gebruik: The 'now' of the sermon ('You can walk out of here this morning').

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (Life is hard) -> Directive (Don't be proud).
voorbeelden: We are creatures... we need to return to the state of creaturehood.
foutief_patroon.probleem: Creates a moralistic burden before the promise is applied.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (Christ is the way) -> Commissive (He shall restore your soul).
voorbeelden: Christ is the way... He shall restore my soul.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: Strongest at the conclusion where the 'I' of the Psalm becomes the 'You' of the congregation.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because Christ is our shepherd... his shepherd dogs will protect us.
voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: We had better come to that [surrender]. God help us if we do not.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon moves from a long constative description of life's difficulty to a comforting promise of Christ as the Shepherd. It avoids pure legalism but spends much time 'talking about' the journey.

sterke_punten.effect: Engages the imagination and creates a shared reality.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: You can walk out of here... if you can truly repeat these words.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Makes the performative event dependent on the hearer's psychological state.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon 'happens' in the final third when the preacher stops describing the road and starts proclaiming the Shepherd.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The 'Toezegging' (Promise) is present but often mediated through the preacher's own experience or the Psalmist's experience rather than a direct 'I promise you'.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Partially. God is the 'One who knows', but the preacher speaks more as a 'religiously educated person' than a mandatory.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: The preacher acts as a witness/testifier more than a herald.
tekstueel_bewijs: I for one lay bold claim to be a religiously educated person.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Low. The Spirit is not mentioned.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: The effect is attributed to the hearer's ability to 'make that surrender'.
tekstueel_bewijs: If you can make that surrender.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The sermon is viewed as a means to peace, but the language is more psychological than sacramental.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: The use of Psalm 23 at the end approaches epiphanic language.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Too many 'is' and 'was' verbs. Need more 'I give', 'He grants', 'Receive'.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The writer of our text confesses his creaturehood.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Confess with the Psalmist today: 'Lord, I am but a creature.'
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from reporting a past act to performing a present one.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: Promises are often conditional or third-person.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Use the 'I-You' address for the promises of Psalm 23.
voorbeeldzinnen: Because Christ is your shepherd, you shall not want.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Directly address the 'you' in the pews with the comfort of the Gospel.
voorbeeldzinnen: You do not have to have the answers, for Christ has them for you.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The call to surrender (Directive) precedes the full beauty of the Shepherd (Indicative).
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Proclaim the Shepherd's faithfulness first, then invite the surrender as a response to that safety.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has a beautiful narrative arc and deep pastoral warmth. By shifting from 'talking about' the journey to 'performing' the guidance of Christ, it will move from a lecture on life to a sacramental event of grace.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' (Uncle Mannie). SAT focuses on whether the 'Commissive' of God's promise actually reaches the hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric would praise the 'sunrise/sunset' imagery. SAT asks if that imagery serves a 'Declarative' function or just a 'Locutionary' one.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's power is bottlenecked by the conditional 'if' in the preacher's primary declarative statement.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: You can walk out of here this morning a saved soul if you can truly repeat these words.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Weakened by the 'if' clause; shifts burden to the hearer.
Strong, creates a new reality for the pilgrim.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'Shepherd' metaphor to do the performative work at the end, which saves it from being a purely constative lecture on aging and wisdom.
